title: SpaceX aces three Falcon 9 launches in 34 hours
summary: SpaceX has successfully launched three Falcon 9 rockets less than 34 hours apart, leaving the company only one mission shy of CEO...

title: L3Harris to acquire Aerojet Rocketdyne for $4.7 billion
summary: L3Harris Technologies on Dec. 18 announced an agreement to acquire Aerojet Rocketdyne for $4.7 billion.

title: NASA signs spaceflight safety agreement with AST SpaceMobile
summary: NASA has signed an agreement with AST SpaceMobile to cooperate on spaceflight safety, even as astronomers grow increasingly concerned about the effects of that company’s satellites.

title: Upper level winds scrub first Electron launch from American soil
summary: Rocket Lab, which has operated its Electron small-satellite launcher successfully from New Zealand since 2017, is about to inaugurate its first US-based launch site. After weather and paperwork-related delays, the mission named “Virginia Is For Launch Lovers” was set to lift off within a two-hour window beginning at 6:00 PM EST (23:00 UTC) on Sunday, Dec. 18.

title: SpaceX launches second mission from Florida within two days
summary: SpaceX has launched the a pair of Falcon 9 missions approximately 23 hours apart from the company’s two Florida launch pads. The first mission carried the first two satellites for a new constellation known as O3b mPOWER to orbit on Friday, Dec. 16, with liftoff coming at the very end of an 87-minute launch window at 5:48 PM EST (22:48 UTC) from Space Launch Complex 40 (SCL-40) at the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station (CCSFS).

title: SpaceX booster launches for record 15th time on Starlink mission
summary: SpaceX launched 54 more Starlink internet satellites Saturday from Kennedy Space Center in Florida, using a Falcon 9 booster on its 15th flight to space, a record for the company’s reusable rocket fleet. The mission was also the third Falcon 9 rocket flight in less than 34 hours from SpaceX’s three active launch pads in less.

title: FAA clears Rocket Lab for first launch from U.S. spaceport
summary: Rocket Lab said Saturday that the company received final approval from NASA and the Federal Aviation Administration to launch their first mission from the United States on Sunday, clearing final regulatory and technical hurdles with a new autonomous range safety destruct unit that delayed the launch more than two years.

title: NASA postpones spacewalk to support Soyuz investigation
summary: NASA is delaying a spacewalk at the International Space Station by two days to support the Russian investigation into a coolant leak on a Soyuz spacecraft docked there.

title: Perseverance prepares to deposit Mars sample cache
summary: NASA’s Perseverance Mars rover will soon start depositing a cache of samples that it has collected since landing last year as part of efforts to eventually return those samples to Earth.

title: VentureScope sets up accelerator for U.S. Air Force personnel
summary: VentureScope, a consulting and venture investment firm that works with entrepreneurs, won a contract to establish to an internal U.S. Air Force accelerator.
